question: A patient comes with 6 weeks amenorrhoea and features of shock-
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Ectopic pregnancy Clinical features of ectopic pregnancyo Classical triad is abdominal pain (100%), amenorrhea (75%) & vaginal bleeding (70%). o Amenorrhea usually of short period (6-8 weeks)o Abdominal pain it is acute, agonising & colicky. Located in lower abdomen: unilateral, bilateral or may be generalised. Sometimes the pain may also be referred to shoulder, o Vaginal bleeding may be slight & continuous, o Vomiting & fainting attack. Signso General look (diagnostic)- Patient is quite & conscious, perspires & looks blanched, o Pallor - Severe & proportionate to the amount of internal haemorrhageo Features of shock - Rapid & feeble pulse, hypotension cold & clammy extremities. o Abdominal examination (lower abdomen) - tense, tumid, tender. No mass felt. Shifting dullness present. Muscle guard is usually absento Pelvic examination - Less informative. Vaginal mucosa is blanched white uterus may b normal in size or bulky. Extreme tenderness on fornix palpation or on cervical movements. The uterus floats as if in the water.

question: A young female with 2 month amenorrhea presents with sudden abdominal pain with adnexal mass, urine pregnancy test is positive. Most likely diagnosis:
exp: Ans. b. Ectopic pregnancy (Ref: William's Obstetrics 22/e p253, 265)

question: Most common site of fertilisation is:
exp: Ans: C (Ampulla) Ref: Dutta: Textbook of Obstetrics 7th ed pg 21. 22. Explanation: FERTILISATIONProcess of fusion of sperm with ovum forming zygote. Fertilisation occurs in the ampullary end of the tube. From ovulation to implantation* Complete dissolution of corona radiata occurs by chemical action of hyaluronidase liberated from acrosomal cap of hundreds of sperm present at the site.

question: 1. Triad of ectopic pregnancy are all EXCEPT:
exp: Ans. (a) Vomiting. Ref: Dutta Obs 7/e 182; William Obs 22/e 258. CLASSIC TRIAD OF ECTOPIC* Pain+ Amenorrhea+ Bleeding per vaginum Triad is present only in 50% case of ectopic* M. C/Consistent finding of Ectopic ->pain. Symptoms* Nausea & Vomiting* Lower Abdom. pain/generalized Abdom pain* Shoulder tip pain Syncopal attacks

question: Least common site of ectopic pregnancv?
exp: Ans. (a) Interstitial End. The image shows a fallopian tube with ovary seen close to the fimbrial end of the tube. The chances of ectopic pregnancy is highest in ampulla(choice c), and least in interstitial part ( Choice a).
